intro: Tragia urens var. linearis, commonly known as the linear leaf tragia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
